name: TheAtlantic
text: In 28 years of teaching, Deloris Fowler has taught through a number of disappointing education reforms. But she's driven to show students the joy in reading‚Äîregardless of the curriculum, writes @natwexler: https://t.co/YKMn2MRcQK

name: TheAtlantic
text: A bulk carrier ship, loaded with about 4,000 tons of fuel oil, ran aground off the coast of Mauritius on July 25. Mauritius has declared a ‚Äústate of environmental emergency,‚Äù as the growing spill threatens nearby reefs and lagoons. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/fxp4qHodd2 https://t.co/vDPGF7HK4i

text: "Millennials are the incarceration generation," argues @JillFilipovic. "From cradle through childhood to parenthood and near middle age, Millennial lives have been shaped and stymied by policing and prisons." https://t.co/pJ80HMHPYi

text: Is Mars overstudied? No, but plenty of other planets (and moons) in our solar system are also worthy of attention, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/jdP8tUAlcG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is Joe Biden‚Äôs pick for vice president. In July, @IsaacDovere wrote that if she were the pick, it would ‚Äúprobably seem like the longest, most drawn-out lead-up to an obvious conclusion in the history of modern presidential politics.‚Äù https://t.co/L4GzkANn4d

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is officially the Democratic vice-presidential candidate. @PeterBeinart writes that Harris‚Äôs tough-on-crime record says ‚Äúless about her than about the country in which she lived.‚Äù  https://t.co/prkJFFF0tp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden‚Äôs running mate, Kamala Harris, is two decades younger than him‚Äîthe potential vice presidency seems like merely a first step, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/EStr94BALr
